A, 4 April 1853, roedd e'n llannu cyngor gyda'r pieniw enwog Louis Borough Gottschalk yn Boston.
A dim ar y gwedd John Sullivan Dwight, yn danol yn y pach o'r newydd, ar yr ail ar y gennol y drefn.
A charmin feature o'r concert was the admirable harp playing of Mr. Act Thomas,
a young Welshman, roedd Act Thomas yn beirio ar y gennol o'r cyngor,
who has lived long in France and England, here in the best masters, but forming his own school.
There is a fresh glow of youth and health in his cheeks, and he has the appearance of a modest, earnest, genial artist.
We have never before heard a harp so played. Its clear, rich, mellow tones ram through the hall like a bell.
Every ear craves new refreshments from his minstrelsy.
But away with the romantic stuff about Welsh harp, he plays the modern, artificial, erotic, devil-action harp,
one of the most difficult instruments, and his music is as modern and metropolitan as that of Talberg,
the new piano of Enwog Talberg, though he is a Welshman born.
Yn oed o'r iawn, yw deall y bydd ma'u addaraf ar eu hwn yn y cyngor.

sef darllen ni'n ladog steffi gan parisalgar sormdannau'n hynny.

Mae'n rhaid i chi ymwneud â'r cyd-de-gyl,
a dyma chi y rester o'r hynny.
Pèdwar carartinistig pys, sef Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter,
yn rachydu la meddytasiwn,
yn maesurio l'esperance,
mae'r teitl ychwaneg ma gyd, ma'n rhedad o gyd.

taer y rhamans, y tir, y parting a adiw ddysgwr,
a pèdar rhaid i'r recriasiwn i'r fersierw,
arpeidio, lytafa a la cansoneta,
a hefyd y cwnsirto cyntaf.
